name: Tips for Eye of Gruumsh build?
author: eltalstro

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
I installed the unofficial 1.72 patch and got access to Eye or Gruumsh. Ideally, the class works best in a party with other evil orcs/half-orcs due to the 'Command The Horde' feat which grants them a +2 will save when active. The class kind of a hybrid barbarian prestige class. I just put Barbarian in the CBC and manually changed the feats and other differences in stats (that I could think of. Any suggestions welcomed.

Ranger(15), Eye of Gruumsh(10), Rogue(15), Half-Orc

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi eltalstro

Cool concept. Dual wielding dev critting half orc with a enrage ability! I like the AB 43 for sure. And of course 8d6 sneak attack with 6 attacks per round yes please.

In addition you have the option of letting out a huge real-life roar that can be heard throughout New Zealand, before your computer character engages the enemy!

In all seriousness I'm trying to understand the Eye of Gruumsh concept, is it the same as this one:
Findaruil wrote: (eye-of-gruumsh-concept-t2354819.html)

I believe the class was installed with the latest CEP along with Shou Disciple and Purple Dragon Knight. Here are the characteristics:

Max 10 levels, Hit die d12, Simple and Martial Weapons, Light and Med Armor, Shields, Skillpoints 2+Int

Prerequisites: Alignment Chaotic evil, Neutral evil or Chaotic Neutral; Race Half-Orc or Orc; Feats Exotic Weapon Prof., Weapon Focus (Double Axe); BAB +6

What it gives you is an improved version of Blind Fight, an improved Rage (Str +4, armor bonus -4), +3 natural armor bonus, +2 saving throws and the ability to spit your stomach's content into your opponent's eyes (yes, that's what it says! :) )

Thanks for the answer!
As such I can understand your desire to obtain Improved Two Weapon Fighting.

I wonder instead of Ranger, if you would consider choosing either Fighter or Champion of Torm (chaotic neutral only) for the bonus feats to obtain Improved Two Weapon fighting.

This would allow you to wear medium or heavy armor without losing dual wielding abilities.

Fighter has the advantage of providing heavy armor proficiency, which CoT does not, an extra bonus feat at level 1 and weapon specialisation/epic weapon specialisation, great feats for a dual wielder.

You will want some good armor on a character with a Dex around 14-15, and light armor might not cut it. 

CoT has no multiclass penalty and extra saves but no heavy armor. If you are leaving Dex at 15 then chain mail (5+2) or chain shirt with dex bonuses (4 +4) might be ok but full plate would probably be superior (8+1) AC wise.

You could take a Fighter 14 / Rogue 16 / EoG 10 split with leveling. Rogue 16 for three bonus rogue feats

The extra rogue level can be taken late to minimise multiclass penalties.  ie Fighter 14 / Rogue 15 / EoG 10, then F14R16EoG10 last two levels

Another option might be Blackguard, extra sneak attack, taunt, a summon, undispellable and stackable bullstrength, all the proficiencies you need, but you will lose saves with a negative cha modifier and you wont have all the lovely bonus feats from F / CoT

I would also drop Wis to 8 and put Dex to 15 if you drop ranger

I would swap slippery mind for improved evasion, and use UMD combined with lesser mind blank or mind blank scrolls to protect the will save.

Haven't looked through some of the other things more in detail but happy to comment further as things go along

Hope these suggestions help

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Thanks Orion,

Yes, Findaruil's summation of the class is a pretty good one. You make a lot of good points here. I absolutely took Ranger for the ITWF but also because I installed additional animal companions including a worg (which is actually weaker than a dire wolf). RP often nerfs my toons but so be it. I like the improved evasion call. I wanted that epic prowess from Ranger 15 so missed out on the Rogue bonus feat at 16. I thought about improved sneak attack or defensive roll but then just went for the +1 attack. I also initially considered the BG option but the CHA issue seemed to make it prohibitive. I'm going to try it out with Ranger and then give it a whirl with Fighter 14 / Rogue 16 / EoG 10.

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content: FYI: It appears the blinding spittle feat is bugged. When you target an enemy the targeting icon stays grey instead of highlighting in tan. It could have to do with haks and overrides I've installed but it could just be bugged which is likely considering the class was never officially released. I did manage to successfully target a sign in front of an inn and then cast what appeared to be mage armour on it.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This is the real Eye of Gruumsh prestige class: https://dndtools.net/classes/eye-of-gruumsh/
And it seems pretty strong if one goes for thirty levels on it, it becomes an AC monster with die-hard, blindsight & an improved rage (+4Str on top of what rage gives).
The thing is, how much the Neverwinter Nights Eye of Gruumsh resembles that?
Does the natural armor bonus stacks with existing amulets of natural armor?
etc.
Otherwise, nice build Eltalstro.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: How does the EoG class go with barbarian? Are there syneries, or will they more or less cancel each other out?

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:How does the EoG class go with barbarian? Are there syneries, or will they more or less cancel each other out?
It is essentially a barbarian prestige class. I think it would work well with barbarian. For your investment you get:
Blindfight
Blindsight out to 10 feet https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Blindsight,_60_foot_radius
Ritual scarring +3AC
3 uses of rage (description says +4 str - 4 AC)
Blinding spittle (which doesn’t work)
Command the horde (boosts evil orc followers)
And +2 to saves at level 10




Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
eltalstro wrote:FYI: It appears the blinding spittle feat is bugged. When you target an enemy the targeting icon stays grey instead of highlighting in tan. It could have to do with haks and overrides I've installed but it could just be bugged which is likely considering the class was never officially released. I did manage to successfully target a sign in front of an inn and then cast what appeared to be mage armour on it.
I have tried this feat in a few other modules and it works fine. The module I had problems with was Tyrants of The Moonsea.

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
It also seems that EoG has a medium BAB rather than a combat class BAB.

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Ah, it's even more useless than I thought initially then.

Sorry for being harsh with it El, but all these new modifications & additions that do nothing, are getting on my nerves.

It would be much better to make some fixes to the real game instead of putting some weak sauce here & there.

All that energy spent on making this class & not a comparatively simple fix to the barbarian's rage (revert to ab & dmg additions instead of str that caps) is beyond my understanding, especially when there are already scripts of these already in the vault for 10 years now.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I think Barbarian's should be able to have uncapped strength when raging

Like it makes sense, 'Super Saiyan Power!' Dragonball Z style (without the annoying long build up that takes up half an episode) and that barbarian explodes into a huge pile of muscles!

Or like All Might in My Hero Academia

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Yes it's definitely not as powerful as Barbarian and works better as an rp class but I think this was available as part of the community enhancement project before EE ever came out. You get a few good feats but it's kind of like PDK or Harper Scout.

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Can't have that Orion, that's hardcoded I believe, that's why the need for the ab/dmg bonuses instead & the temporary hp's.
And personally, I wouldn't mind even 6 episodes of build-up (battle vs Frieza) as long as the rage was worth it 😉 

@eltalstro, have you seen the frenzied berserker? Totally mad class, its featured in nwn2. Now that would be a class worth porting over.
frenzied berserker => https://dndtools.net/classes/frenzied-berserker/
Or scholar of candlekeep, red wizard, for mages too, they need some love as well, if you are gonna bring such powerhouses into the game.

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
eltalstro wrote:It also seems that EoG has a medium BAB rather than a combat class BAB.

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk
I was wrong. Combat class BAB for EoG.

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:@eltalstro, have you seen the frenzied berserker? Totally mad class, its featured in nwn2. Now that would be a class worth porting over.
frenzied berserker => https://dndtools.net/classes/frenzied-berserker/
Or scholar of candlekeep, red wizard, for mages too, they need some love as well, if you are gonna bring such powerhouses into the game.
Yes, I have, Valerfor. After NWN, NWN2 is my second most played game. It was a pity it didn't have quite the same online presence as the original. I thought it was really good and I managed to get the hang of the camera that people seemed to hate so much. The allowance for four classes meant you could make some crazy builds. My NWN PW never changed over to it, and then the community kind of disappeared (although Layonara is still going). It would be really cool to get all of the additional classes from NWN2 in NWN. I actually reckon the EoG class is pretty decent after having played with it a bit. Full combat AB, blindsight to 10 ft (takes the place of listen skill), Blindfight, rage, a morale boost to saves plus a few other goodies are not too bad. It's definitely more of an RP class but the fighter, rogue, EoG that I'm playing around with is tearing through the Underdark with such reckless abandon I'm thinking about switching to hardest difficulty. If I could add some Frenzied Berserker levels Mephistopheles wouldn't have a snowball's chance in hell.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Eh, I find it hard to talk about NwN II, because it could have been so much better with just a few steps in the right direction, but it does indeed have many good things about it. For once, the polygon models in it have aged so much better than the NwN 1, ones & there are quality enhancements too like feats remain active until you switch them off. It's from the same era of games that overused bloom effects so much, Oblivion did it too but at the time the graphics did look very nice indeed (In Oblivion's case especially.) But then, you had some questionable moves, like the overall nerfing of tumble/spellcraft skill, the elimination of time stop & the shortening of available levels to just 30. It would still have worked fine until they decided to just ignore D&D rules altogether & advance BAB all the way to the end.

Now, you understand that nobody liked to lose potential extra attacks, so the multi-class combinations were restricted profoundly  & certain "best" combinations emerged without any room for tinkering or creative thought, such as (Fighter 12/ Bard 1/ RDD 10/ Weapon Master 7). Add to that, the kind of "jerky" animations that belonged more in an RTS type of game that zoomed into the battlefield (HoM&M), instead of a real-time RPG like NWN supposed to be & you kind of starting to form the whole picture. Moreover, the move of most PWs into some kind of real-life, role-playing type of game instead did not help either, I have seen some NwN II PWs that restricted leveling to just 12.

In secret, I wish we had most of the improvements NwN II had, but with the freedom that we have in the original game, oh that would have been brilliant, brother!
Anyway, if you are still playing both games, then I suggest you take a look at this module by Tiberius, https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... -gods-saga
It's a masterpiece.
